activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12136
activity.text:
@JagjeevanAK  @modamaan 
So I've been looking at the FileQuestion component and think I've found the problem. The dropdown stays open because:

We're using preventDefault() on the file input which stops the dropdown from closing naturally
The camera and audio buttons don't have any code to close the menu after clicking
I'm thinking we can fix this by:

Adding a state variable to track if the dropdown is open or closed
Connecting this state to the DropdownMenu component
Adding handlers for file upload, camera, and audio that will close the menu
Getting rid of that preventDefault() that's keeping it open
It's a pretty straightforward fix - just need to manage the dropdown state properly.
ETA : Today

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12131
activity.text:
@aravindm4 @Jacobjeevan  @rithviknishad I'd like to request assignment for this issue.

## Proposed Solution:
I'll optimize the PatientIndex component by implementing useMemo hooks to prevent unnecessary recalculations of appointment filtering and sorting operations. My approach will:

1. Identify the three key areas needing optimization:
   - The main appointment filtering and datetime sorting logic
   - Past appointments filtering
   - Scheduled appointments filtering

2. Implement useMemo hooks for each operation with carefully defined dependency arrays that only trigger recalculations when necessary data changes (like filters, sort criteria, or appointment data)

3. Ensure proper typing for all memoized values

This will significantly improve performance with larger datasets by preventing redundant calculations on every render.

End date: Today
